body.p:
Beriah Magoffin,
GOVERNOR OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
TO ALL WHO SHALL SEE THESE PRESENTS, GREETING

WHEREAS, It is represented to me that A J. Edwards, who was convicted of the crime of Felony at the term, of the Owsley Circuit Court, and sentenced to confinement in the Penitentiary of One years. AND WHEREAS, It appears from satisfactory evidence, that the case of the said A. J. Edwards presents strong considerations for the interposition of the Executive

Now, Know Ye, That in consideration of the premises, and by virtue of the power vest in my by the Consitution, I do hereby grant unto the said ^A. J Edwards^ a remittance of the forfeiture of his right of suffrage occurred by said sentence A FREE AND FULL PARDON for said offense; and do order that he be forthwith liberated from confinement, and released from all liability thereunto in consequence of said judgment of conviction; and I direct that all officers of this State respect this Pardon.

In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused the Seal of the Commonwealth to be affixed, at FRANKFORT, on the day of , in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and, and in the year of the Commonwealth.

, SECRETARY OF STATE.
"Yeoman" Office -- J. B. MAJOR, State Printer.
